body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Have the latest IntelliJ Ultimate or Android Studio and Flutter plugin, latest version.
1. Create new Flutter project in latest IntelliJ.
1. Run it as Chrome or Web.
1. Click to `+` icon couple of times. Observe counter in the middle is not `0`.
1. Open main.dart in IDE, change `primarySwatch: Colors.blue` to `primarySwatch: Colors.green`.
1. Save the file.
1. Observe browser counter in the middle goes to `0` again.

Comment in main.dart says ```Notice that the counter didn't reset back to zero; the application is not restarted.```
However, the counter clearly resets back to zero for me. 

## Version info

```
$ flutter doctor -v
```

comment_data.body:
> Comment in main.dart says Notice that the counter didn't reset back to zero; the application is not restarted.
However, the counter clearly resets back to zero for me.

Thanks for the report! This is currently working as expected. That sample would correctly maintain state across reloads while running on flutter mobile. Flutter web currently maps a 'reload' operation as a restart - a quick restart of the app - and restores the pages url from before the restart. The state of the app is not retained (modulo the navigation location).

title: New project "hot reload" does "restart" instead
